newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Alcatel to raise output at Brazil unit.
newsitem.headline: Alcatel to raise output at Brazil unit.

text.p: French telecoms giant Alcatel will invest $250 million in Brazil this year and plans to more than double capacity at its local unit to 750,000 lines, a company official said.

Jean Francois Fille, senior country officer for Alcatel, told Reuters that this year's investment plan was intended to "recapitalize" the local subsidiary as well as boost capacity at its Sao Paulo plant.
Alcatel Telecomunicacoes S.A. now produces 350,000 lines a year, he added
Fille said he did not know yet how much the firm planned to spend in Brazil next year.
Alcatel is interested in the upcoming privatization of Brazil's B Band cellular frequency, but not to be an operator.
"It is interested in Band B to supply technology," Fille said.

Alcatel in France annually sells some $10 billion in telecommunications equipment while its subsidiaries abroad sell an additional $3 billion, local unit Communications and Marketing Manager Guilherme Athia said.
The Alcatel group employs 5,000 people in Brazil in telecommunications, energy and transportation divisions, with total annual sales of more than $600 million.

Alcatel telecoms sales in the country reached $360 million last year with orders this year worth $450 million. Its Brazilian unit is the second-largest supplier of telecommunications equipment in the country, officials said.
